conversation.text:
For fans of intense historical dramas, I would recommend 'Born on the Fourth of July' (1989). This film tells the true story of Vietnam War veteran Ron Kovic, who becomes an anti-war activist after his paralysis experience.

Alternatively, if you're looking for a classic romantic thriller with a touch of Hollywood magic, 'Casablanca' (1942) might be more suitable. This film stars Humphrey Bogart as Rick Blatnik, the owner of the titular Casablanca, alongside Claude Rains as the manipulative Major Strasser.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I recommend "Hotel Rwanda" (2004) for its powerful portrayal of the events during the Rwandan genocide, featuring Cara Seymour and a cast led by Don Cheadle.

Alternatively, you might enjoy "You" (2014), a psychological thriller starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt as an online stalker who becomes increasingly obsessed with his victims.
